all_text_timv: Crespin, Régine. sng Songs of Ravel & Satie. Songs of Ravel and Satie New York : Sony Classical, [1998] 1 audio disc : digital ; 4 3/4 in. 005451 performed music prm rdacontent audio s rdamedia audio disc sd rdacarrier Vocal masterworks The Ravel work for soprano and piano, with texts by Jules Renard; the Satie songs for soprano and piano, with texts by various authors; the Beethoven work a scene and aria for soprano and orchestra, with text in part by Pietro Metastasio. Consists of previously released material. Compact disc. Program notes by Régine Crespin in English with French and German translations and song texts in French or Italian with English translations (16 p. : ports.) inserted in container. Histoires naturelles. Le paon ; Le grillon ; La cygne ; Le martin-pêcheur ; La pintade / Maurice Ravel -- Le chapelier ; Tendrement ; Daphénéo ; L'omnibus automobile ; La statue de bronze ; Je te veux; Chanson du chat ; La diva de "L'empire" / Erik Satie -- Ah! perfido : op. 65 / Ludwig van Beethoven. Louise de la Fuente, reissue producer. Régine Crespin, soprano ; Philippe Entremont, piano (Ravel, Satie) ; New York Philharmonic ; Thomas Schippers, conductor (Beethoven). The Ravel and Satie works recorded at L'Église Notre-Dame de Liban, Paris, France, on Nov. 26-30, 1979; the Beethoven work recorded at Manhattan Center, New York City, on Feb. 9, 1965. Regine Crespin sings songs of Maurice Ravel and Erik Satie. Sung in French (Ravel, Satie) or Italian (Beethoven). Renard, Jules, 1864-1910 Musical settings. Metastasio, Pietro, 1698-1782 Musical settings. Metastasio, Pietro, 1698-1782. fast (OCoLC)fst00051632 Renard, Jules, 1864-1910. fast (OCoLC)fst00017688 Songs (High voice) with piano. Songs (High voice) with orchestra. Songs (High voice) with orchestra. fast (OCoLC)fst01126150 Songs (High voice) with piano. fast (OCoLC)fst01126153 Musical settings. fast (OCoLC)fst01423813 Renard, Jules, 1864-1910. Metastasio, Pietro, 1698-1782. Entremont, Philippe. prf Schippers, Thomas. cnd Ravel, Maurice, 1875-1937. Histoires naturelles. Satie, Erik, 1866-1925. Songs. Selections. Satie, Erik, 1866-1925. Mélodies (1916) Satie, Erik, 1866-1925. Tendrement. Satie, Erik, 1866-1925. Omnibus automobile. Satie, Erik, 1866-1925. Je te veux. Satie, Erik, 1866-1925. Ludions. Chanson du chat. Satie, Erik, 1866-1925. Diva de l'empire. Beethoven, Ludwig van, 1770-1827. Ah, perfido. New York Philharmonic. prf Vocal masterworks.
general_note_ssm: The Ravel work for soprano and piano, with texts by Jules Renard; the Satie songs for soprano and piano, with texts by various authors; the Beethoven work a scene and aria for soprano and orchestra, with text in part by Pietro Metastasio.
Program notes by Régine Crespin in English with French and German translations and song texts in French or Italian with English translations (16 p. : ports.) inserted in container.

creation_production_credits_ssm: Louise de la Fuente, reissue producer.
